question: Should .cleo/ checkpoint commits be isolated to a dedicated .cleo/.git repo using GIT_DIR/GIT_WORK_TREE env vars, with SQLite backup via VACUUM INTO rotation replacing git tracking of tasks.db?

votes.rationale: Structural isolation eliminates staging scope bug class entirely. VACUUM INTO via getNativeDb() provides zero-dep SQLite snapshots. Litestream refuted (T4877): requires sidecar + external storage, incompatible with local-first CLI model.

Option A is the correct architectural decision. Path-fix-only (Option B) is a band-aid; removing git checkpointing (Option C) loses text file history. Isolated .cleo/.git is the minimum viable structural fix.

decision: Adopt Option A (isolated .cleo/.git) + VACUUM INTO rotation for SQLite backups
